Title: ADC, APC chieftain warn Tinubu to shelve re-election, focus on governance
Summary: The African Democratic Congress (ADC) and a former All Progressives Congress (APC) presidential hopeful have slammed President Tinubu’s early re-election campaign as illegal and tone-deaf . They accuse the ruling party of ignoring Nigerians’ suffering while violating electoral laws .

Title: Ayinde risks ban over unruly behaviour at Abuja airport
Summary: Fuji musician, Wasiu Ayinde aka KWAM1, risks being placed on a ‘no-fly’ list by the Nigerian Civil Aviation Authority (NCAA) following his unruly behaviour during boarding at the Abuja airport .

Title: IPAC writes RSIEC, rejects August 30 state LG elections
Summary: The Inter-Party Advisory Council of Nigeria (IPAC) has written to the Chairman of the Rivers State Independent Electoral Commission (RSIEC), Dr Micheal Odey . The umbrella body of all registered political parties in Nigeria has rejected August 30, 2025, as the date for local council elections in Rivers State .

Title: JAMB sets high bar for under-16 candidates
Summary: Joint Admissions and Matriculation Board (JAMB) has announced that exceptionally brilliant under-16 candidates must score a minimum of 320 in the 2025 Unified Tertiary Matriculations Examination (UTME) JAMB has also set other stringent conditions for admission to tertiary institutions .

Title: Six FMCG firms’ cost of sales surge by 24% to N562 billion in Q2
Summary: Six of Nigeria's leading fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG) companies collectively incurred N562 billion as cost of sales in the second quarter (Q2) Despite achieving strong operational performance, six of Nigeria’s leading leading FMCG companies incurred more than 24% in Q2 .

Title: Tinubu directs PenCom to implement pension increases
Summary: Tinubu directs PenCom to implement pension increases and minimum pension guarantee . He also mandated the National Pension Commission to expedite rollout of the scheme . The President has also mandated PenCom to eliminate pension increases .

Title: FG approves tax incentives for manufacturers using local raw materials
Summary: Federal Government to introduce tax incentives for Nigerian manufacturers that use locally sourced materials . •Nigeria’s manufacturers import 70% of their input . The move is a bid to curb the high import of raw materials and other manufacturing inputs .
